content_scrubbed:
As an atheist I don't have to go around continuously telling myself there is no greater power. When I go about my life, I have no experiences revealing that a god of any kind exists, and I have come across no evidence to believe in one, let alone to believe in your specific version. So my conclusion, to choose to live as though I don't believe in any gods, seems obvious and rational to me. 

I don't know what you mean exactly when you say that everything came by 'chance', I don't feel like I can justly respond to that part of your comment. I've also never been much of a student of science so I'm not qualified to talk in depth about cosmology, abiogenesis and evolution~

As for whether or not anything I accomplish will last? Well I don't know what I will accomplish in life, nor how those accomplishments will resound with other people. I work in the arts, so certainly I have hopes that my work will touch people at least within my contemporary surroundings/time, but I can't tell you whether I'll be remembered. I hope I'll be but I could never tell you that I deserve to be remembered for eternity. 

I can't just believe in an afterlife because I don't want to face that perhaps I'll be forgotten someday. 

I'm pretty okay with that. 

Which beliefs feel natural to you, do not feel natural to everyone. 

I hope I came across concisely and that you might understand a little something more about one atheist[.] perspective, at least.
